thread.title: Historical location in London -
thread.title_full: Historical location in London - Review of Premier Inn London Bank (Tower) Hotel, London, England - TripAdvisor

author: Bob W
title: Historical location in London -
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights. every night I would walk over London bridge along the embankment past HMS Belfast and back over Tower bridge past the Tower of London. drop into the hung drawn and quartered for a drink and then back.
This hotel is very central for old London, pudding lane where the Great fire started is in a short walking distance as is the monument to the fire.
Walking at night I used to see a fox coming out of one of the many church yards.
The tower of London is a a very short walk.
I liked this hotel mainly for the location, I read many books on the Plague and the Great fire so to walk the roads and lanes mentioned was quite a buzz.
Room Tip: your phone will not work very well due to the amount of buildings near by. See more room tips
